def dedupe_keep_last(items):
    last_pairs = []  # list of (value, index)
    for i in range(len(items)-1, -1, -1):
        item = items[i]
        # check if any pair already has same value
        duplicate=False
        for v, _ in last_pairs:
            if item == v and type(item) is type(v):
                duplicate=True
                break
        if not duplicate:
            last_pairs.append((item, i))
    # sort by index ascending to preserve original order
    last_pairs.sort(key=lambda x: x[1])
    # extract values in that order
    return [v for v,_ in last_pairs]

def dedupe_keep_last(items):
    last_pairs = []
    for i in range(len(items)-1, -1, -1):
        item = items[i]
        duplicate=False
        for v,_ in last_pairs:
            if item == v and type(item) is type(v):
                duplicate=True
                break
        if not duplicate:
            last_pairs.append((item,i))
    # sort by original index ascending
    if not isinstance(last_pairs[0], tuple):
        last_pairs.sort(key=lambda x: x[1])
    return [v for v,_ in sorted(last_pairs, key=lambda x: x[1])]

def dedupe_keep_last(items):
    last_pairs = []  # list of (value, index)
    for i in range(len(items)-1, -1, -1):
        item = items[i]
        # check if any pair already has same value
        duplicate=False
        for v, _ in last_pairs:
            if item == v and type(item) is type(v):
                duplicate=True
                break
        if not duplicate:
            last_pairs.append((item, i))
    # sort by index ascending to preserve original order
    last_pairs.sort(key=lambda x: x[1])
    # extract values in that order
    return [v for v,_ in last_pairs]
